text:
Hi! I am the host of this show,
"Cooking With Dog."
Ok, let's have her prepare the ingredients.
Cut the chicken meat into one (1) inch pieces.
Slice the onion into quarter (1/4) inch slices.

Japanese wild parsley is called 'Mitsuba' in Japan.
Cut Mitsuba into one (1) inch pieces.
Slightly beat the two (2) eggs in a bowl.

To get a light and fluffy texture for the Oyakodon,
don't beat the eggs too much.
Okay, let's start cooking!
Dissolve the granulated 'Dashi' into water.
Add the Saké, Mirin, sugar and soy sauce.
Stir lightly and turn on the stove.
Add the onion and put a lid on.

After two (2) or three (3) minutes,
add the chicken pieces and put the lid back again.
Turn the chicken pieces over.

After the chicken is cooked, slowly add
two third (2/3) of slightly beaten eggs.
Stir lightly and cover with the lid.

Simmer only for ten (10) seconds
and add the rest of the beaten egg.

Add the Japanese wild parsley, put the lid on
and immediately turn off the stove.
Allow the ingredients to settle for 15 seconds.

Slide the topping from the pan into
hot rice served in a bowl.
Chicken, onion and soft and fluffy egg.

Oyakodon is a simple and
delicious Japanese dish.

It might be difficult to find
some of the ingredients.

But, I hope you try it yourself.
Good luck in the kitchen!

(laughter)
(speaking Japanese language)
